qas.question: What is a mathematical tool used for organizing intervals of time?
What is a physical tool that tracks the passage of time?
Which tool is used in day to day life?
Which tool is used in periods longer than a day?
How is the number that marks the occurrence of an event obtained?

answers.text: by counting from a fiducial epoch—a central reference point

qas.question: For how long does chronometry usually display a reference point?
What do fiducial epochs display at the same time?
What physical mechanism is used to count periods longer than a day?
What organizational mathmatical tool is used for a time period of less than a day?
What do people usually carry with them at all times?
What is a mathematical tool used for organizing intervals on clocks?
What is a physical tool that tracks the passage of points?
Which tool is used in periods longer than an interval?

plausible_answers.text: by counting from a fiducial epoch

qas.question: How is the number that marks the occurrence of an interval obtained?
What takes three distinct period forms?

context: Temporal measurement, <b14_0>chronometry<b14_0/>, takes two distinct period forms: <a0_0><b10_0>the calendar<b10_0/><a0_0/>, a mathematical tool for organizing intervals of time, and <a1_0><b11_0>the clock<b11_0/><a1_0/>, a physical mechanism that counts the passage of time. In day-to-day life, <a2_0><b7_0>the clock<b7_0/><a2_0/> is consulted for periods <b5_0>less than a day<b5_0/> whereas <a3_0><b8_0><b12_0>the calendar<b12_0/><b8_0/><a3_0/> is consulted for periods longer than a day. Increasingly, <b9_0>personal electronic devices<b9_0/> display <b6_0>both calendars and clocks<b6_0/> simultaneously. The number (as on a clock dial or calendar) that marks the occurrence of a specified event as to hour or date is obtained <a4_0><b13_0>by counting from a fiducial epoch<b13_0/>—a central reference point<a4_0/>.
